bug.author: afi1289
bug.summary: Problem with installing nlp-architect in google-colab
bug.description:
Hello, I have the following error by installing nlp-architect in google colab: <denchmark-code>! pip install nlp-architect </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>ERROR: umap-learn 0.4.6 has requirement numpy>=1.17, but you'll have numpy 1.16.4 which is incompatible. ERROR: torchvision 0.8.1+cu101 has requirement torch==1.7.0, but you'll have torch 1.4.0 which is incompatible. ERROR: tensorflow-probability 0.12.1 has requirement gast>=0.3.2, but you'll have gast 0.2.2 which is incompatible. ERROR: fbprophet 0.7.1 has requirement tqdm>=4.36.1, but you'll have tqdm 4.35.0 which is incompatible. ERROR: en-core-web-sm 2.2.5 has requirement spacy>=2.2.2, but you'll have spacy 2.1.8 which is incompatible. ERROR: datascience 0.10.6 has requirement folium==0.2.1, but you'll have folium 0.8.3 which is incompatible. ERROR: albumentations 0.1.12 has requirement imgaug<0.2.7,>=0.2.5, but you'll have imgaug 0.2.9 which is incompatible. ERROR: botocore 1.19.57 has requirement urllib3<1.27,>=1.25.4; python_version != "3.4", but you'll have urllib3 1.24.3 which is incompatible. ERROR: seqeval 1.2.2 has requirement scikit-learn>=0.21.3, but you'll have scikit-learn 0.20.2 which is incompatible. Installing collected packages: sentencepiece, jmespath, botocore, s3transfer, boto3, tqdm, sacremoses, numpy, tokenizers, transformers, blis, preshed, plac, thinc, spacy, scikit-learn, torch, dynet, seqeval, gast, keras-applications, tensorflow-estimator, tensorboard, tensorflow, nlp-architect Found existing installation: tqdm 4.41.1 Uninstalling tqdm-4.41.1: Successfully uninstalled tqdm-4.41.1 Found existing installation: numpy 1.19.5 Uninstalling numpy-1.19.5: Successfully uninstalled numpy-1.19.5 Found existing installation: blis 0.4.1 Uninstalling blis-0.4.1: Successfully uninstalled blis-0.4.1 Found existing installation: preshed 3.0.5 Uninstalling preshed-3.0.5: Successfully uninstalled preshed-3.0.5 Found existing installation: plac 1.1.3 Uninstalling plac-1.1.3: Successfully uninstalled plac-1.1.3 Found existing installation: thinc 7.4.0 Uninstalling thinc-7.4.0: Successfully uninstalled thinc-7.4.0 Found existing installation: spacy 2.2.4 Uninstalling spacy-2.2.4: Successfully uninstalled spacy-2.2.4 Found existing installation: scikit-learn 0.22.2.post1 Uninstalling scikit-learn-0.22.2.post1: Successfully uninstalled scikit-learn-0.22.2.post1 Found existing installation: torch 1.7.0+cu101 Uninstalling torch-1.7.0+cu101: Successfully uninstalled torch-1.7.0+cu101 Found existing installation: gast 0.3.3 Uninstalling gast-0.3.3: Successfully uninstalled gast-0.3.3 Found existing installation: tensorflow-estimator 2.4.0 Uninstalling tensorflow-estimator-2.4.0: Successfully uninstalled tensorflow-estimator-2.4.0 Found existing installation: tensorboard 2.4.0 Uninstalling tensorboard-2.4.0: Successfully uninstalled tensorboard-2.4.0 Found existing installation: tensorflow 2.4.0 Uninstalling tensorflow-2.4.0: Successfully uninstalled tensorflow-2.4.0 Successfully installed blis-0.2.4 boto3-1.16.57 botocore-1.19.57 dynet-2.1 gast-0.2.2 jmespath-0.10.0 keras-applications-1.0.8 nlp-architect-0.5.4 numpy-1.16.4 plac-0.9.6 preshed-2.0.1 s3transfer-0.3.4 sacremoses-0.0.43 scikit-learn-0.20.2 sentencepiece-0.1.95 seqeval-1.2.2 spacy-2.1.8 tensorboard-1.15.0 tensorflow-1.15.2 tensorflow-estimator-1.15.1 thinc-7.0.8 tokenizers-0.0.11 torch-1.4.0 tqdm-4.35.0 transformers-2.4.1 WARNING: The following packages were previously imported in this runtime: [numpy] You must restart the runtime in order to use newly installed versions. </denchmark-code>
I am using MacBook with safari browser.

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/afi1289>@afi1289</denchmark-link> , it seems to me that its okay, you should restart the runtime Let me know if it doesn't work
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/peteriz>@peteriz</denchmark-link> I think the problem was with my code which call keras.contrib from nlp-architect Thank you for your reply!
